channel.title: Alexander Soto | Bridging Social Justice and Technology
channel.description: Recent content on Alexander Soto | Bridging Social Justice and Technology

item.title: Org-mode Hugo Test
item.description: Second test. This is a simple test to see how well this will work for me to be writing in the future different blog posts through emacs. I intend to use emacs org-mode in combination with hugo, emacs org-mode will publish the contents of the draft as a markdown file and then be able to upload the file

item.title: About
item.description: My name is Alexander Soto. I’m an activist, educator, technologist and agent of social change. My interests are in exploring issues in community-building, social justice, education and leveraging technology to address social problems. I’m a technology teacher in Boston Public Schools at the Margarita Muñiz Academy and a graduate student at Northeastern University studying Computer Science.

item.title: Humble Beginnings
item.description: In today’s world, major tech companies, educators and policymakers are pushing for STEM education. As a mentor at Resilient Coders and a Technology teacher at the Margarita Muñiz Academy, I strongly believe in the economic advancement and creating opportunities for youth for the betterment of society. My beginnings with technology starts in early childhood. During the weekends I visited my father and spent most of the time with my brother Robinson.
